Prerequisites on Github  Create a public respository blog_code for storing the code. Create an another public repository mygithubname.github.io to deploy (publish) the site. This one must have the same name as the Github username.  Open a shell on your dev environment Clone the blog_code respository.
git clone git@github.com:isibox/blog_code.git Go to the blog_code folder.
cd blog_code Create a new site with Hugo hugo new site cloud-guru-blog Install a theme for Hugo Go to new site folder, and then in the themes folder.
cd ./cloud-guru-blog/themes Clone the themes you want to use.
git clone https://github.com/CaiJimmy/hugo-theme-stack.git Go back to the site folder and rename the config.toml file site.
cd .. mv config.toml config.yml Configure the site to use the chosen theme
baseURL:"http://isibox.github.io/"languageCode:"en-us"title:"Cloud-Guru's Blog"theme:"hugo-theme-stack"Create a first post hugo new posts/my-first-post.md And then, edit the file and write an simple example like below:

git clone git@github.com:isibox/isibox.github.io.git Go in deploy repository and create a new branch main. and then create an empty README.md file.
cd isibox.github.io git checkout -b main touch README.md Then commit the change:
